prop.head.headtext: Confidential Business Information and the Employment Relationship

para.paratext: Prior to 1994, the Civil Code of Lower Canada, in force since 1866, contained no provisions dealing specifically with the contract of employment. Over the years, the courts, often inspired by the case law developed in the Common Law provinces, created a body of principles dealing with typical employment law problems.
In 1994, the Civil Code of Québec[2] (“C.C.Q.”) was adopted. It contained a specific chapter entitled “Contract of Employment” in which many of the principles of the existing case law were codified.
This section on Quebec Law was written by Luc Deshaies of the Montréal office of Gowling Lafleur Henderson LLP.
